title.narrative: F.a: Youth groups constructing political citizenship in Guatemala

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to improve the social influence of young people and to increase their participation in municipal decision-making and civil society networks in order to promote the realization of children's and young people's rights in their commu nities. Young people were provided civic education and encouraged to act as active citizens. Also duty-bearers are trained in the importance of consultation and inclusion of young people. Active members of the youth movements are responsible for the planni ng, implementation, monitoring, evaluation and reporting of their activities to the Project Coordinator. In this way, young people learn to take responsibility and have the capacity to act independently for the fulfillment of child and youth rights even af ter the end of the project. The cooperation started through an open call for tenders in 2005. http://pami-guatemala.org/wp/ More than 70% of the Guatemalan population is under 30 years old, and more than 50 % is under 20 years old. The social problems of t he country, such as street violence, corruption and impunity, poverty and poor quality of basic services, raise serious challenges and threats in the environment the youth grow up in.
